alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 26 at 3:07PM MDT until June 26 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND UPPER RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH DRY THUNDERSTORMS... .Strengthening southwest flow across northwestern New Mexico in advance of a slow moving Pacific low will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions both Monday and Tuesday. The strongest winds are expected Tuesday, when isolated, gusty, and dry thunderstorms are also forecast with areas of extreme fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and North Central Mountains (Zone 120) until 8 pm this evening, as well as Tuesday afternoon and early evening. Dry thunderstorms will favor locations along and east of the continental divide on Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph today. Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph on Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of these Red Flag Warnings.
